result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan S. Albright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Comply with any and all counseling recommended by agent

timeConds.notes: Sentenced to 5 months Marquette County Jail, conditional

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Restitution Supplement

Defendant Nathan S. Albright in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Nathan S. Albright in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF58 & 15CM92 tracking together:
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 in 15CF58 to Felony Retail Theft 943.50(1m)(b).  Atty Gumz agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court will amend Ct. 1 in 15CF58 to Felony Retail Theft 943.50(1m)(b).
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1 in 15CF58.  Counts 2, 3 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.  15CM92 to be dismissed.
Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1 in 15CF58.  Counts 2, 3 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.  15CM92 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations; defendant is in Waushara County.  
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to accept the joint recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  15CF58:  Amended Ct. 1:  Withhold Sentence; 3 years Probation with conditions:
Court orders 5 months in the Marquette County Jail, conditional 
Restitution = $1,464.43 + surcharge = $1,610.87
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge (if not done so already)
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
bond to be applied to Restitution
Credit = 10 days if revoked.
Counts 2, 3 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.  
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

15CM92 to be dismissed.

Return date at 12-17-2015 03:30 pm
- Notice sent to Waushara County Jail per Atty Gumz

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant waived his prelim; Atty Gumz stated that the defendant is in Waushara County Jail.  The State was unaware of that so he was not brought here.
Atty Gumz states that he did meet with this client and asks the court to continue the matter.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Return date at 11-05-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Nathan S. Albright in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Signed and posted by  Surety - Marcia Albright
Posted by Marcia Albright
Statement of Compliance
Preliminary hearing at 09-16-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Nathan S. Albright in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Nathan S. Albright in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived. 
Set Prelim.
bond continued.

Atty Gumz states that he will be filing a bail motion next week.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing at 09-04-2015 11:00 am

Defendant Nathan S. Albright in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Nathan S. Albright in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant does qualify for PD.  Atty Hendee states that an amended complaint has been filed this morning; the wrong business was listed in the original complaint.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant received the amended criminal complaint and waives the reading.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant is not waiving time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Set Prelim within 10 days.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Status conference at 09-03-2015 10:00 am
*Not to go on the premises of Burger King or BP in Westfield, WI.

Defendant Nathan S. Albright in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Nathan S. Albright in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant is out on two bonds from Marquette County and Waushara County.  Atty Hendee requests a $5,000 cash bond.  Atty Gumz responds and requests a $500 cash bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,250 cash bond with conditions:
*Not to go on the premises of Burger King or BP in Westfield, WI.
  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
